title: 111_s1603
content: The Act may be cited as the "Veterans Education Tuition Support Act of 2009" or the "VETS Act of 2009." It provides tuition relief for postsecondary students called to military service. The "Veterans Education Tuition Support Act of 2009" or the "VETS Act of 2009" offers tuition relief for postsecondary students called to military service. Section 484B(b)(2) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to provide tuition refunds for students who withdraw from institutions due to military service. The "VETS Act of 2009" amends the Higher Education Act to provide tuition refunds for students who withdraw from institutions due to military service. The Secretary can waive repayment amounts for students called to military service. The Secretary can waive repayment amounts for students called to military service and provide loan forgiveness for withdrawals necessitated by service in the uniformed services. The Secretary can waive repayment amounts for students called to military service and provide loan forgiveness for withdrawals necessitated by service in the uniformed services. For payment periods where a student did not receive academic credit due to withdrawal, a program is implemented through the loan holder to repay the outstanding loan principle and interest, minus any returned loan assistance. The Secretary can waive repayment amounts for students called to military service and provide loan forgiveness for withdrawals due to service in the uniformed services. Loan assistance awarded to the student can be canceled, including outstanding principle and accrued interest on loans under part D or E. The Secretary reimburses institutions for Perkins loan cancellations by paying an amount equal to the aggregate of loan assistance awarded to students under part D or E, minus any returned amounts. The Secretary reimburses institutions for Perkins loan cancellations by paying an amount equal to the aggregate of loan assistance awarded to students under part D or E, minus any returned amounts. The Secretary shall pay institutions for cancelled Perkins loans, minus loans made from Federal capital contributions. No funds from section 461(b) are available for these payments. The Secretary reimburses institutions for Perkins loan cancellations by paying an amount equal to the aggregate of loan assistance awarded to students under part D or E, minus any returned amounts. Institutions qualify for payments within 3 months of filing an application for campus-based funds. Returned or forgiven amounts for students not receiving academic credit due to military service withdrawal are excluded from loan calculations. The text states that periods of enrollment where a student withdraws due to military service will not count towards their annual or aggregate loan limits. The effective date for these amendments is after the enactment of the Act. The amendments made by this Act will apply to periods of service in the uniformed services starting after the enactment date. A "period of service in the uniformed services" is defined as the time from 30 days before a student is required to report for service until they return from service.
